title: Does Facebook remove copyrighted music? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you post cocpyrighted music on FB, or any social site, the protocols are as follows: The copyright holder has to find your infringhement and report it. Some sites will contaxt you to ask if you wish to dispute the claim—others will just pull your submission outright. The big copyright licensing people use bots to roam sites like YouTube to find infringement sso they can kill them. On FB, the likelihood they’d find your music is smaller since they’d have to have access to all your stuff-so if your privacy settings are not “public” they’ll not see them. Also, if you’re using a link to, say, YouTube, then they’ll just have to go complain to YouTube and that will kill your link. The odds you’ll receive any legal action as nil.
